comments.body: Rather than modifying the test, can we test both the new values (500/700 etc) and the values with very small deltas?

This test depends extensively on the "width of each tab will equal 100", per line 1279. It would be best to restore that invariant and make sure everything still works without changing the other dimensions around.
That's exactly what I did here: `68 + kTabLabelPadding.horizontal == 100`
Sorry about that. Apparently I can't add :-)

This test looks like it needs to be revised. It should confirm that the onTap() call is applied to the correct index and that it happens even when the default tap handler doesn't have any effect on the TabController.

should you also add an:

```dart
expect(find.text('Tab3'), findsOneWidget);
```

Now that there should be an additional tab?
You could say that this is a regression test for https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/20292

This test could probably be much simpler. For example it could just rebuild the frame with different values of tabTextContent and not bother with the buttons and icons and so on. However if we're reproducing the test case that was originally used to demo the bug, it's OK.

I think the primary motivation I had was to make sure that it not only initializes to zero tabs just fine, but also accounts for dynamically updating the number of tabs from > 0 to zero as well. I'll add a comment to clarify this.

comments.body: You would also need to apply the `indicatorColor` and `Material.color` to be the same value in the test, since it's expected that otherwise, the color of the indicator is always the expected value
